title: Former President Donald Trump to take the stand in New York civil fraud trial
description: Donald Trump and three of his children, Donald Jr., Eric and Ivanka, are testifying before a New York judge. They are facing questions over fraudulent Trump Organization financial statements.

title: Republicans have had most of Iowa's attention all year. Democrats want to change that
description: As Republicans barnstorm the state, a high-profile visit by Sen. John Fetterman, D-Pa., was designed to bolster enthusiasm for an Iowa Democratic Party that hasn't had the easiest few years.

title: What Virginia's legislative elections could spell for 2024 on abortion rights
description: Virginia voters are deciding whether to keep divided government at the state level. At stake is the chance to dramatically reshape abortion policy.

title: 3 cities face a climate dilemma: to build or not to build homes in risky places
description: Towns across the U.S. want to stop building homes that are vulnerable to climate-driven disasters, like wildfires, floods and droughts. It's easier said than done.

title: A mother's run for mayor raises a difficult question: How does Uvalde move forward?
description: Kimberly Mata-Rubio's daughter Lexi was killed in the Robb Elementary shooting. Now, as she runs for mayor, some residents see her as a painful reminder of a tragedy they're trying to move on from.

title: How wildlife officials saved a humpback whale found 'hogtied' to a 300-pound crab pot
description: The juvenile whale was seen swimming in a clockwise circle, making unusual noises and trailing two buoys. A team of wildlife experts had to move fast, but with plenty of patience, to save its life.

title: North Korea says it is closing some diplomatic missions around the world
description: Experts point to economic difficulties from prolonged international sanctions, but the closures may signal a possible change in North Korea's foreign policy that is more focused on Moscow and Beijing.

title: A potential Las Vegas workers strike could throw a wrench in the upcoming F1 race
description: Some 35,000 workers with the Culinary and Bartenders Union could walk off the job Friday if no contract deal is reached. The Formula 1 Las Vegas Grand Prix is scheduled to take place later this month.

title: He went looking for his uncle — and ended up seeking forgiveness at a mass grave
description: Angel Irizarry is a former detective who worked on missing persons cases. In 2021, he set out on a personal investigation: to find his uncle Cesar, who had been estranged from his family for decades.

title: Tai chi helps boost memory, study finds. One type seems most beneficial
description: Research shows that a daily dose of tai chi, the slow-moving meditative, martial art can boost our body and brain. A new study finds adding word games to tai chi doubles the increase in memory.

title: The unlikely connection between universal pre-K and nicotine taxes in Colorado
description: Colorado voters in 2020 approved raising hundreds of millions of dollars to establish a universal pre-K program. That money comes from a surprising — and controversial — source: tobacco tax revenue.
